verses.verse: Then <S%H464>Eliphaz<s%> the <S%H8489>Temanite<s%> <S%H6030>answered,<s%>
"Should a wise <S%H2450>man<s%> <S%H6030>answer<s%> with <S%H7307>vain<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge,<s%> and <S%H4390>fill<s%> <S%H990>himself<s%> with the east <S%H6921>wind?<s%>
Should he <S%H3198>reason<s%> with <S%H5532>unprofitable<s%> <S%H1697>talk,<s%> or with <S%H4405>speeches<s%> with which he can do no <S%H3276>good?<s%>
<S%H6565>Yes,<s%> you do away with <S%H3374>fear,<s%> and <S%H1639>hinder<s%> <S%H7881>devotion<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H410>God.<s%>
For your <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> <S%H502>teaches<s%> your <S%H6310>mouth,<s%> and you <S%H977>choose<s%> the <S%H3956>language<s%> of the <S%H6175>crafty.<s%>
Your own <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7561>condemns<s%> <S%H8193>you,<s%> and not I. Yes, your own lips testify against <S%H6030>you.<s%>
"Are you the <S%H7223>first<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> who was <S%H3205>born?<s%> Or were you <S%H2342>brought<s%> forth <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H1389>hills?<s%>
Have you <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H5475>secret<s%> counsel of <S%H433>God?<s%> Do you <S%H1639>limit<s%> wisdom to <S%H2451>yourself?<s%>
What do you <S%H3045>know,<s%> that we <S%H3045>don't<s%> know? What do you <S%H995>understand,<s%> which is not in us?
With us are both the <S%H7867>gray-headed<s%> and the very <S%H3453>aged<s%> <S%H3524>men,<s%> much <S%H3117>elder<s%> than your <S%H1>father.<s%>
Are the <S%H8575>consolations<s%> of <S%H410>God<s%> too <S%H4592>small<s%> for <S%H1697>you,<s%> even the word that is gentle toward <S%H328>you?<s%>
Why does your <S%H3820>heart<s%> carry you <S%H3947>away?<s%> Why do your <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7335>flash,<s%>
That you <S%H7725>turn<s%> your <S%H7307>spirit<s%> against <S%H410>God,<s%> and let such <S%H4405>words<s%> go <S%H3318>out<s%> of your <S%H6310>mouth?<s%>
What is <S%H582>man,<s%> that he should be <S%H2135>clean?<s%> What is he who is <S%H3205>born<s%> of a <S%H802>woman,<s%> that he should be <S%H6663>righteous?<s%>
<S%H539>Behold,<s%> he puts no trust in his <S%H6918>holy<s%> <S%H8064>ones.<s%> Yes, the heavens are not <S%H2141>clean<s%> in his <S%H5869>sight;<s%>
how much less <S%H376>one<s%> who is <S%H8581>abominable<s%> and <S%H376>corrupt,<s%> a man who <S%H8354>drinks<s%> <S%H5766>iniquity<s%> like <S%H4325>water!<s%>
"I will <S%H2331>show<s%> <S%H8085>you,<s%> listen to <S%H2372>me;<s%> that which I have seen I will <S%H5608>declare:<s%>
(Which <S%H2450>wise<s%> men have <S%H5046>told<s%> by their <S%H1>fathers,<s%> and have not hidden <S%H3582>it;<s%>
to whom alone the <S%H776>land<s%> was <S%H5414>given,<s%> and no <S%H2114>stranger<s%> <S%H5674>passed<s%> among <S%H8432>them<s%>):
the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> man <S%H2342>writhes<s%> in pain all his <S%H3117>days,<s%> even the <S%H4557>number<s%> of <S%H8141>years<s%> that are <S%H6845>laid<s%> up for the <S%H6184>oppressor.<s%>
A <S%H6963>sound<s%> of <S%H6343>terrors<s%> is in his <S%H241>ears.<s%> In <S%H7965>prosperity<s%> the <S%H7703>destroyer<s%> shall come on <S%H935>him.<s%>
He <S%H539>doesn't<s%> believe that he shall <S%H7725>return<s%> out of <S%H2822>darkness.<s%> He is <S%H6822>waited<s%> for by the <S%H2719>sword.<s%>
He wanders <S%H5074>abroad<s%> for <S%H3899>bread,<s%> <S%H3045>saying,<s%> 'Where is it?' He knows that the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H2822>darkness<s%> is <S%H3559>ready<s%> at his <S%H3027>hand.<s%>
<S%H6862>Distress<s%> and <S%H4691>anguish<s%> make him <S%H1204>afraid.<s%> They <S%H8630>prevail<s%> against <S%H4428>him,<s%> as a king <S%H6264>ready<s%> to the <S%H3593>battle.<s%>
Because he has stretched <S%H5186>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> against <S%H410>God,<s%> and behaves himself <S%H1396>proudly<s%> against the <S%H7706>Almighty;<s%>
he <S%H7323>runs<s%> at him with a stiff <S%H6677>neck,<s%> with the <S%H5672>thick<s%> <S%H1354>shields<s%> of his <S%H4043>bucklers;<s%>
because he has <S%H3680>covered<s%> his <S%H6440>face<s%> with his <S%H2459>fatness,<s%> and <S%H6213>gathered<s%> <S%H6371>fat<s%> on his <S%H3689>thighs.<s%>
He has <S%H7931>lived<s%> in <S%H3582>desolate<s%> <S%H5892>cities,<s%> in <S%H1004>houses<s%> which no one <S%H3427>inhabited,<s%> which were <S%H6257>ready<s%> to become <S%H1530>heaps.<s%>
He shall not be <S%H6238>rich,<s%> neither shall his <S%H2428>substance<s%> <S%H6965>continue,<s%> neither shall their <S%H5186>possessions<s%> be <S%H4512>extended<s%> on the <S%H776>earth.<s%>

He shall not <S%H5493>depart<s%> out of <S%H2822>darkness.<s%> The <S%H7957>flame<s%> shall dry <S%H3001>up<s%> his <S%H3127>branches.<s%> By the <S%H7307>breath<s%> of <S%H6310>God<s%>'s mouth shall he go <S%H5493>away.<s%>
Let him not <S%H539>trust<s%> in <S%H7723>emptiness,<s%> <S%H8582>deceiving<s%> <S%H7723>himself;<s%> for emptiness shall be his <S%H8545>reward.<s%>
It shall be <S%H4390>accomplished<s%> <S%H3808>before<s%> his <S%H3117>time.<s%> His <S%H3712>branch<s%> shall not be <S%H7488>green.<s%>
He shall shake <S%H2554>off<s%> his unripe <S%H1154>grape<s%> as the <S%H1612>vine,<s%> and shall cast <S%H7993>off<s%> his <S%H5328>flower<s%> as the olive <S%H2132>tree.<s%>
For the <S%H5712>company<s%> of the <S%H2611>godless<s%> shall be <S%H1565>barren,<s%> and <S%H784>fire<s%> shall <S%H398>consume<s%> the <S%H168>tents<s%> of <S%H7810>bribery.<s%>
They <S%H2029>conceive<s%> <S%H5999>mischief,<s%> and bring <S%H3205>forth<s%> <S%H205>iniquity.<s%> Their <S%H990>heart<s%> <S%H3559>prepares<s%> <S%H4820>deceit.<s%>"
